ext_descriptions.ext_description: An Expanded_uncertainty is a type of . The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
the coverage_factor specifies the real number for the Expanded_uncertainty.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS. A Standard_uncertainty is a type of . A Standard_uncertainty may be an Expanded_uncertainty. The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
The uncertainty may be or . The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
A Maximum_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Maximum_tolerance_characteristic indicates the maximum allowed value for the parameter specified.

The Measure_qualification provides information about measurements in which there is an associated uncertainty. The uncertainty may be specified as precision, qualitative uncertainty, or expanded uncertainty, and the type of the related datum shall be included. The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
the qualifiers specifies the for the Measure_qualification. There shall be one or more Value_qualifier for each qualifiers.
the qualified_measure specifies the for the Measure_qualification.
the description specifies the that provides additional human-interpretable information for the Measure_qualification.
the name specifies the that serves to identify the Measure_qualification.
A Minimum_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Minimum_tolerance_characteristic indicates the minimum allowed value for the parameter specified.

A Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Plus_minus_tolerance_characteristic includes a minimum, maximum, and nominal characteristic numeric parameter. All three have the same base unit, but may have different prefixes.
A Statistical_tolerance_characteristic is a type of . The Statistical_tolerance_characteristic supports the exchange of properties defined by statistical distributions.

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS. A Symmetrical_tolerance_characteristic is a type of that has symmetrical tolerances around the nominal value. The structure is a nominal value with a ratio. The ratio is applied to the nominal value and applies to both plus and minus. A resistance of 22 Ohm plus or minus 10% would be represented with two values, 22 Ohm and .10 since the same quantity 10% is referenced on both sides of the nominal value. An unsymmetrical distribution would be represented with a member of .
A Tolerance_characteristic is a type of . A Tolerance_characteristic may be one of , , , , or .

The text description for this Application Object has not been fully updated to agree with the EXPRESS. in which there is an associated precision. Precision_qualifier shall be interpreted in accordance with precision_qualifier in part 45 of this standard. ... ... ... ... note to Darla...what is the right way to do this? The precision is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
A Qualitative_uncertainty is a type of . The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
A Range_characteristic is a type of that specifies a range of values. The range may be open or closed. The range may be single ended.

the range_type specifies the classification of the Range_characteristic. The Range_characteristic shall be open, closed, lower_open or upper_open. Open shall be interpreted as not including the end point or points in the range. Closed shall be interpreted ass including the end point or points in the range.
The Type_qualifier specifies an uncertainty. The uncertainty is defined in clause 2 of "The Guide to the Expression of Uncertainty in Measurement".
